results.title: Salvador Allende Gossens: a testimony
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Jean-Marc Garand, Maurice Bulbulian and Michel Gauthier
results.brief_description: A brief acquaintance with the president of Chile before his assassination in September, 1973. In 1972, several miners from Quebec went to Chile to observe mining operations there. They also met with the President of the Republic. Salvador Allende explains, publicly at a meeting of icampannerors, as well as in a conference with the visitors, the revolutionary socio-economic reforms he envisages for his country, which include nationalisation of the copper industry. Rene Levesque, Theo Gagne and Joseph Gosselin appear in the film. (A film for all students of political change. With English subtitles)

results.title: Salvador
results.creator_credit: Hemdale Film Corporation, Gerald Green and Oliver Stone
results.brief_description: Seduced by the lure of cheap drink, drugs and sex, an experienced photo- journalist goes with his friend to El Salvador in the early 1980s. Once there they see the turmoil and brutality of the country as it is being destroyed by the conflict, and learn of American involvement. Largely based on the experiences of Richard Boyle, a photo-journalist there in the 1980s. Stars James Woods, James Belushi and Michael Murphy.

results.title: Salty
results.creator_credit: Victorian College of the Arts, Georgina Harper, Sonia Whiteman and Marion Lee
results.brief_description: Short drama about a fleeting first love between a teenage girl and boy living in an urban beach community. Figuring the couple against an elemental background of eternal sky and sea, the narrative builds on the accumulation of tender moments between them, until the time comes when the boy must leave. Through his fascination with sea salt as a symbol of permanence, the film contrasts the boy’s state of unsettledness with the girl’s solid sense of place. Cast includes Tom Budge and Jacqui Swallow.

results.title: Salting the earth
results.brief_description: This video looks at the causes of both wetland and dryland salting, its effects and some solutions. No other credits available.

results.title: Salting and soil reclamation
results.brief_description: Explains how the salt concentration in arid soils can be built up due to over-irrigation and removal of overgrowth; how salting can be prevented in irrigation areas by controlled irrigation and how, when salting does occur, the land can be used for pastures or reclaimed and brought back to full production by tile drainage.

results.title: Salt: the hidden threat
results.creator_credit: Alfred Higgins Productions and Stephen Wallen
results.brief_description: The case against excess salt is accumulating steadily. While it is estimated the body needs only 200 milligrams a day to stay healthy, many people consume 6,000 milligrams a day. In the film, examples are given of hidden salt and suggestions are made about how to reduce the amount of salt in our diets.

results.title: Salt Creek
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, colour and audio
results.brief_description: With ‘Salt Creek’, Seoungho Cho turns his hypnotic camera eye on the harsh terrain of Death Valley. Through a series of delicate formal manipulations, he folds representations of a coldly beautiful landscape into images of seething video static, water sluicing out of a tap, and a surveillance view from one office tower into another. Stephen Vitiello’s score echoes the image track in describing a gradual arc of inhospitable elegance, rhythmic grace, and decay.

results.title: Salt cod
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Tom Daly and Allan Wargon
results.brief_description: Cod fish have been caught and processed for export along the coast of Newfoundland for the past four centuries. This film traces the growth of industry and shows the present day methods of handling this harvest from the seas. At the height of seasons, fishermen and their families labour from dawn to dusk hauling in and preserving the catch. The work of splitting, salting, drying and grading is shown, and concluding reference is made to the more recent quick freeze method.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ONF | NFB, Tom Daly and Allan Wargon

results.title: Salt and hypertension: how to save your life
results.brief_description: Gloria Taylor, public health educator presents the evidence suggesting that we can minimize the risk of high blood pressure by reducing salt intake. Examines the sodium content of a typical daily menu and shows how to use herbs and spices to replace sodium.

results.title: Salt
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Amber Goodwyn, Morgan Gage, Karen Shamy-Smith and Beverly Brown
results.brief_description: Four documentary ‘filmzines’, each directed by a seventeen-year-old female student assisted by a professional film crew provided by the National Film Board of Canada. The films evolved from fanzines (low-tech, independently produced niche magazines), produced by the young filmmakers that addressed issues central to their lives. Their ‘windows into youth culture’ range from alternative music and punk subculture to self-mutilation and education. ‘Salt’ stays true to its roots, using innovative digital imaging techniques to maintain the feel of the ‘zines’ that inspired its making. A comprehensive companion website to the film project can be found at http://www.nfb.ca/salt/
